description:
The Black Spectacles ARE® Live Podcast is your home for navigating the road to passing the Architect Registration Exam (ARE®) and becoming a licensed architect.  

Episodes include discussions about specific ARE & NCARB topics, interviews with distinguished architects & guests, and recordings of live broadcasts covering specific exam topics and questions and answers from a live audience.

http://blackspectacles.com
title: ARE Live

episodes.title: ARE Live: Project Development & Documentation Mock Exam
episodes.description:
Resident expert Mike Newman guides us through a Project Development & Documentation mock exam. We will cover PDD knowledge and skills relating to building materials, building systems, detailing and documentation, project specifications, and adhering to code requirements. Extra studying for one of the big tests like PDD is always valuable so don’t miss it.

Engage on our ARE Community and find the link to the mock exam here - https://community.blackspectacles.com/t/are-live-project-development-documentation/1977

episodes.title: ARE Live: How to Pass the ARE During Stressful Times
episodes.description: We will hear from a panel of architects who passed the ARE during some stressful times in their lives. They’ll give good insight into how to stay focused, how to carve out time to study, how to overcome exam day jitters and how they ultimately completed all the divisions. This will be really useful to help navigate your testing and studying schedules right now.

episodes.title: ARE Live: PPD Virtual Workshop Exercise
episodes.description: Get to know what our Virtual Workshops are all about! We'll feature one of our group exercises for the PPD exam led by our Virtual Workshop coach so you get a variety of practice and preparation for test day. Be sure to go through the exercise and accompanying questions, then follow along as Coach Liz reviews the exercise and answers live - https://blackspectacles.typeform.com/to/qJcHtvh0

episodes.title: ARE Live: Programming & Analysis Mock Exam - 2020
episodes.description: Join Black Spectacles and ARE expert Mike Newman as we review a Programming & Analysis mock exam. Touching on development knowledge and skills relating to architectural programming, environmental, social, and economic issues, as well as codes and regulations, you’ll be the pro when we’re done. Take the mock exam here so you're ready to follow along - https://blackspectacles.typeform.com/to/mmoVg6

episodes.title: ARE Live: Project Planning & Design Mock Exam - 2020
episodes.description:
We will use a mock exam to cover Project Planning & Design issues relating to the generation or evaluation of design alternatives that synthesize environmental, cultural, behavioral, technical and economic issues. 

Take the mock exam here - https://blackspectacles.typeform.com/to/fImnQNU7 and follow along as Mike explains the answers.

episodes.title: ARE Live: Project Management Mock Exam - 2020
episodes.description: Join Black Spectacles and architect Mike Newman for our Project Management mock exam. With these practice questions, we will explore issues related to resource management, project work planning, project execution, and project quality control.

episodes.title: ARE Live: Practice Management Mock Exam
episodes.description: Join Black Spectacles and architect Mike Newman for our Practice Management mock exam. With these practice questions, we will explore issues related to creating a team, ethics, standard of care, and everything else you should know about the practice management side of architecture.

episodes.title: ARE Live - Construction and Evaluation Mock Exam 2020
episodes.description:
Join us as we discuss Construction & Evaluation with Mike Newman. Using a mock exam, we’ll cover all of the most perplexing and difficult topics in this division of the ARE.

With these practice questions, we will explore issues related to bidding and negotiation processes, support of the construction process, and evaluation of completed projects.

To view 2019 Construction & Evaluation Mock Exam visit: https://blackspectacles.com/podcast/episode/construction-evaluation-mock-exam-2019-are-live

To view the the thread in our ARE Community with Marc about adapting to our new normal; working from home and practicing social distancing visit: https://community.blackspectacles.com/t/how-are-you-adjusting-to-the-new-norm/923/58

And if you’re looking for a new study method, check out our comprehensive ARE prep modules: https://blackspectacles.com/products/are-exam-prep

15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership:
Visit: http://blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: CE031920PC

episodes.title: ARE Live: How to Remove Diversity Obstacles from Licensure
episodes.description: Getting licensed is a rigorous process and takes most aspiring architects several years to complete. It’s easy to look at the ARE and licensure as a major obstacle in the way of where you want to go with your career. During this episode, we will discuss how to remove diversity obstacles in the path to licensure with a panel of architects. Our panelists will share their experiences and provide some solutions-oriented advice on how to overcome those hurdles, and how colleagues and leaders can eliminate them in the profession. We'll share solutions to overcoming obstacles that are applicable to everyone in the field. What is Black Spectacles? We're the only learning platform created entirely for architects. We offer an entire suite of study materials -video lectures, online practice exams, and digital flashcards - to get you licensed fast. And if you’re looking for a new study method, check out our comprehensive ARE prep modules:https://blackspectacles.com/products/are-exam-prep

episodes.title: Understanding the Question Types on the ARE - 2019 | ARE Live
episodes.description:
Learn why and how the questions on the ARE are written so that you’re prepared to own them on test day. 

Heather Rivera, our resident architect, will explain the 5 question types you’ll see on the ARE . She will dive into why they exist and the best ways to efficiently attack them. After this episode, you’ll know how to beat the questions rather than letting them beat you. 

This episode is best viewed as a video because of the visual nature of the practice exams. You can view the video here: https://bksp.es/utq2019

episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: http://blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: STEPS41018PC

With different requirements in each state, it’s no secret that there’s a lot to consider on your path to licensure. 

Join us at this ARE Live Podcast episode to shore up your understanding of the steps to getting licensed. We’ll be live with two licensing advisors showing you what the general licensure requirements are, then we’ll break down how licensure requirements vary by state. 

After this episode, you’ll understand everything you need to do in order to become a licensed architect so you can get back on track to licensure. 

And if you’re looking for a new study method, check out our comprehensive ARE prep modules: https://blackspectacles.com/products/are-exam-prep

episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: http://blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: CONTRACT3618PC

Join us as we discuss the contracts and legal issues that you’ll need to be familiar with when you take the ARE. 

Hear from Mike Newman and Attorney Mike Hanahan, Partner at Schiff Hardin and UIC Adjunct Professor (in charge of the famous Schiff Hardin lectures). He is regularly involved in both negotiating major construction contracts and representing clients in project-related disputes. 

Using real contracts, Mike and Mike will show you what you need to know about the B101, A201, and A101 when you take the exam. 

After this episode you’ll feel comfortable demonstrating your understanding of the concepts & principles of the contracts that you’ll need to be familiar with when you take the ARE.

episodes.title: Recently Licensed Architects - How They Passed | ARE Live
episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: http://blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: HOW81517PC

Do you want to know the best tips and tricks for passing the ARE? Join us and our panel of newly licensed architects for the opportunity to pick the brains of some of the best and brightest. 

Find out their study strategies, discover their most useful resources, and learn about different approaches to taking the exam. 

Hear each of our panelists discuss their approach to the ARE including study strategies, study materials and resources, advice they'd give other young architects or the best advice they've received themselves, and why their exam approach is the right one for them. Listen in and get some first-hand tips and advice to help you choose your own ARE path.

And if you’re looking for a new study method, check out our comprehensive ARE prep modules: https://blackspectacles.com/products/are-exam-prep

episodes.title: Construction & Evaluation Mock Exam Review | ARE Live
episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: 71117CEPC

Join Black Spectacles and Mike Newman for our Construction & Evaluation discussion. Using a mock exam, we’ll cover all of the most perplexing and difficult topics in this division of the ARE. 

With these practice questions, we will explore issues related to bidding and negotiation processes, support of the construction process, and evaluation of completed projects. 

These tools will help you feel comfortable demonstrating your understanding of construction contract execution, construction support services, payment request processing, and project closeout.

Take the mini-mock exam here: http://bksp.es/cne-questions

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.title: Programming & Analysis Mock Exam Review | ARE Live
episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: 6617PAPC
 
Join Black Spectacles and Mike Newman for our Programming and Analysis discussion. We will be using sample mock exam questions as an opportunity to discuss some of the more vexing topics, as well as delve into strategies for answering. This will be a good introduction to the types of problems that you are likely to find on the Programming and Analysis exam and how best to respond. 
 
With these practice questions, we will explore issues related to programming, site analysis, and zoning & code requirements. 
 
These tools will help you feel comfortable demonstrating your understanding of project type analysis, the establishment of qualitative and quantitative project requirements, evaluation of project site and context, and assessment of economic issues.
 
Take the mini-mock exam here: http://bksp.es/pna-mock-exam
 
Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

Join Black Spectacles and Mike Newman for our Practice Management discussion. We will be using sample mock exam questions as an opportunity to discuss some of the more vexing topics, as well as delve into strategies for answering. This will be a good introduction to the types of problems that you are likely to find on the Practice Management exam and how best to respond. 

This division of the ARE focuses on the management of an architecture practice, covering such topics as professional ethics, fiduciary responsibilities, and the regulations governing the practice of architecture. 

With these tools, you will be able to understand and demonstrate abilities in business structure, business development, and asset development and protection. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.title: Everyone Passes on the First Try: An ARE Strategy Discussion with 3 Young Architects | ARE Live
episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: http://blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code:  1871PC1016

In this live episode, Marc Teer and Mike Newman were joined by a panel of 3 young architects who are each taking a different route to the Architect Registration Exam (ARE). Laura Crane, Associate at bKL Architecture LLC who recently completed the exam in version 4.0, Sarah Hitchcock, Gensler who is taking the 5-Exam Plan (a combination of ARE 4.0 and ARE 5.0), and Greg Kristo, Stantec Architecture who will be taking the entire exam in version 5.0.

Hear each of our panelists discuss their approach to the ARE including study strategies, study materials and resources, advice they'd give other young architects or the best advice they've received themselves, and why their exam approach is the right one for them. Listen in and get some first-hand tips and advice to help you choose your own ARE path.

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
Visit: http://blackspectacles.com/membership
and enter code: 216SPDPC15  

Join Marc Teer and Mike Newman as they review the questions and vignettes of the Site Planning and Design Exam in this episode of ARE Live. Site Planning is a combination exam, with both multiple choice type questions and significant graphic vignettes. There is a lot of crossover with other exams, but this is still an exam that trips up many contenders. This webinar will focus on the guiding principles and basic assumptions of site planning as well as a few pointers and strategies regarding the site vignette diagrams, including planning and topography. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.description:
15% Discount on a Black Spectacles Membership for AIA Members:
http://bksp.es/idp-and-are

In this episode of ARE Live we're going to the beginning and engaging in an in-depth discussion about what it really takes to become a licensed architect.

Join Marc Teer, Mike Newman and Frank Heitzman as they discuss education requirements, continue with a deep dive into the Intern Development Program (IDP), including all of the recent changes, and discuss what the Architect Registration Exam (ARE®) is and how to plan to pass it.

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

Frank Heitzman is the founding principal of Heitzman Architects, a senior lecturer at Triton College, and has been a long time licensing advisor for the State of Illinois.

episodes.title: How to Pass the ARE (From People Who’ve Actually Done it!)
episodes.description:
Join Marc Teer and Mike Newman as they welcome architects Charlie Klecha from Quinn Evans in Detroit, Jennifer Rittler from Moody Nolan in Columbus, and Josh Mings from Landon Bone Baker in Chicago. What do all of these architects have in common? They have all taken the ARE and passed it! And they’ve all come together on this episode of ARE Live to share their stories, insights and advice on how to go about preparing for, taking, and (perhaps most importantly) celebrating passing (or failing!) the exam. Don’t miss out on this unique insight into the ARE! 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.title: The Devil You Know: A Question and Answer Session with Mike Newman
episodes.description:
Are you worried about the switch from ARE 4.0 to 5.0? You shouldn’t be! In this episode of ARE Live, Mike Newman tells you why the switch from 4.0 to 5.0 isn’t as bad as it seems. He will also be answering questions submitted by you, the listeners, and discussing a set of diverse topics that range from different types of wood to the finer points of light bulb efficiency and sustainability. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.title: Translating into Engineer Speak: A Structural Systems Mock Exam
episodes.description:
How do you build a hospital so it can withstand an earthquake? How do you calculate axial loading bearing capacity? How do you draw out a shear moment diagram? Find out with today’s episode, the Structural Systems Mock Exam featuring Mike Newman and Heather Heidenreich.  You can download this mock exam and answer the questions yourself, and then listen in. The questions will help you develop a strategy for how to study for the exam and some of the formulas, tables, and terms you’re going to see in this exam, such as Allowable Stress Design, Camber, and Belled Caisson. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Studio.

Heather Heidenreich is a structural engineer at the Chicago office of KJWW, an international engineering consulting firm with expertise in designing sustainable and high performance building infrastructure systems. 

Download the Mock Exam-
http://bksp.es/structuresproblems
AIA ARE Prep powered by Black Spectacles-
blackspectacles.com/courses

episodes.title: It’s a Puzzle, not Architecture - The Schematic Design Vignettes
episodes.description:
You’re all set for your Building Design Vignette, you know exactly what you want to do, you’re going to make the most beautiful, amazing, mind-blowing design NCARB has ever seen! Too bad they don’t care. At all. Did you follow the Program? Did you pay attention to the Specialty Moments? Is it accessible? That’s all they care about, and it can mean the difference between a passing and failing exam. You can learn more tips for these vignettes in today’s episode of ARE Live. Mike Newman will be going step by step through sample Building Design and Interior Design Vignettes, showing both passing and failing examples, and giving advice on how to create a system creating these vignettes and avoiding the common mistakes people make when taking this exam. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

AIA ARE Prep powered by Black Spectacles-
blackspectacles.com/courses
Mike's Recommended Resources to pass the ARE:
blackspectacles.com/blog/books-need…-exam-resources

episodes.title: How the AIAS President passed all 7 ARE exams in 7 days
episodes.description:
Today we’re following up on our earlier interview with Charlie Klecha, President of the AIAS, who a few weeks ago was telling us how he was planning on taking all 7 of the ARE exams in 7 days. Which he did. And he passed them. All of them. In a week. 
Black Spectacles Founder Marc Teer will be asking Charlie how he went about studying for the exams, what resources he used, and what tips and tricks he has for passing the ARE (spoiler alert: it’s called studying very, very hard). 

For more on Charlie’s story, check out 
http://aias.org/7in7/ 
to watch his weekly videos and track his process from beginning to end.  

And to learn more about the PASS Scholarship visit:
http://aias.org/pass/ 

AIA ARE Prep powered by Black Spectacles-
blackspectacles.com/courses
Recommended Resources to pass the ARE:
blackspectacles.com/blog/books-need…-exam-resources

episodes.title: Everything you always wanted to know about Liquefied Sewage: A Building Systems Mock Exam
episodes.description:
Ready to learn the finer points of on-site waste disposal terminology? How about transformers types? And what does DX stand for? Find out in today’s episode of ARE Live, as Mike Newman reviews the 10 questions & answers from our Building Systems Mock Exam. You can download this mock exam and answer the questions yourself, and then listen in. The questions will help you develop a strategy for how to study for the exam and some of the terms you’re going to see in this exam, such as Leaching, Step Down Transformer, and Enthalpy. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Studio.

episodes.title: Just what is a Mechanic’s Lien, anyway? A Construction Documents and Services Mock Exam
episodes.description:
Do you know what Standpipe is? How about what’s expected of you according to the A201 General Conditions? Who signs the A201 General Conditions? What are the A201 General Conditions!? Find out in today’s episode, the Construction Documents and Services Mock Exam with Mike Newman. You can download this mock exam and answer the questions yourself, and then listen in. The questions will help you develop a strategy for how to study for the exam and some of the terms you’re going to see in this exam, such as Standard of Care, Zoning Analysis, and A201 General Conditions. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Studio.

episodes.title: The Big ARE Switch: Moving from 4.0 to 5.0
episodes.description:
Everything you have ever known is about to change!

...concerning the ARE, that is. 

Well, maybe not everything. It will be generally the same concepts, but with some key differences. In this episode of ARE Live, Mike Newman will go over some of those differences, give you a few tips on how to think about the new exam and will ultimately help you decide whether you should consider taking “the devil you know” (ARE4.0) or trying out a new paradigm in the Architect Registration Exam.

episodes.title: How to get Started Passing the ARE
episodes.description:
Studying for and passing the ARE is a huge undertaking - where do you even start? Today Mike Newman talks about his top ten tips to pass the ARE, including how to get started, the different types of exams, and the quickest way to take all of the exams. He’ll also be talking about how find the best study materials and what not to post on the NCARB forums.

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Chicago.

episodes.title: Programming Planning & Practice Mock Exam- Answered
episodes.description:
In today’s episode, Mike Newman reviews the 10 questions & answers from our Programming, Planning & Practice Mock Exam.  You can download this mock exam and answer the questions yourself, and then listen in.  The questions will help you develop a strategy for how to study for the exam and some of the terms you’re going to see in this exam.

One thing to note, there is a lot of overlap between PPP and some of the other exam topics, you will notice that some of these questions could easily find themselves on other exams.  You may want to consider studying and taking this exam with Construction Documents & Services and Site Planning & Design- you will find that they are all about the same issues, just from different vantage points. 

Mike Newman is an instructor for the AIA ARE Prep Curriculum powered by Black Spectacles, he’s an Adjunct Professor at the School of the Art Institute Chicago, and he also runs his own architectural practice, SHED Studio.
